content: fidget socks a free pattern by amy stringer these socks are knit from the toe up with your choice of short row or after-thought heel this pattern is suited to knitters of all levels if you ve knit a sock before then you ll be able to knit this too this pdf contains links to a number of tutorials which you may find useful the stitch pattern on this sock is another take on a basketweave style stitch without all the purling the simple easily memorised pattern is fun and relaxing to knit the simplicity of this pattern makes it a great unisex sock - and its easy to add extra personality with your favourite yarn figures in this pattern are intended to fit a medium womens sized foot with a medium mens size included in brackets before you get started… materials glossary what stitches will we be 100g fingering weight yarn using 2 25mm us1 dpns / k - knit stitch circular needle or needle required to achieve gauge kfb - knit into front and back of the stitch stitch markers gauge p - purl stitch 30 sts & 38 row across 4 inches in stocking stitch sl2yf - slip 2 sts purlwise from left to have a question get in touch unstretched after blocking right needle with the yarn held in find me as phancee on ravelry front of the stitch toe foot leg cast on - cast on a total of 18 24 set up row - k33 36 *k2 p1* 11 once you have finished the heel stitches using judy s magic cast on - 12 times you should be at the end work the pattern as you had for the i e 9 12 stitches on each needle of the round foot for one full pattern repeat to set up for the toe increases k 9 the rest of the foot is worked as k33 continue knitting the pattern repeat 12 place marker for middle of the 36 to first marker and work pattern across all sts work in pattern until round k 9 12 place marker for the repeat until next marker leg measures 1½ inches less than end of the round desired length ensuring that row 6 work until the foot is approx 1½ or 12 of the pattern repeat is the last toe increases -
